Top Markers

Source: R/topMarkers.R
topMarkers.Rd

Top Markers

topMarkers(data, n = 10L, direction = c("positive", "negative",
  "both"), coding = FALSE)

Arguments

data

grouped_df. Seurat::FindAllMarkers() return, sanitized with our sanitizeSeuratMarkers() function.
n

scalar integer. Number of genes per cluster.
direction

string. Whether to include "positive", "negative", or "both" directions of association per cluster.
coding

boolean. Include only protein coding genes.

Value

grouped_df.

See also

  • dplyr::slice().

  • dplyr::top_n().

Other Clustering Functions: cellTypesPerCluster, knownMarkersDetected, plotCellTypesPerCluster, plotFeature, plotKnownMarkersDetected, plotMarker, plotPCElbow, plotReducedDim, plotTopMarkers, sanitizeSeuratMarkers

Examples

x <- topMarkers(
    data = all_markers_small,
    n = 2L,
    direction = "positive"
)
glimpse(x)
#> Observations: 4
#> Variables: 18
#> $ cluster        <fct> 0, 0, 1, 1
#> $ avgLogFC       <dbl> 1.1586621, 1.5726929, 0.9477752, 1.2452577
